title: Variables & Templates
description: Create variables to store data and display a formatted message.
instructions:
1.  Create a `const` variable named `city` with the value `'New York'`.
2.  Create a `let` variable named `temperature` with the value `72`.
3.  Use `console.log()` and a Template Literal (backticks) to display exactly: `The temperature in New York is 72`.

testCases.expectedOutput: The temperature in New York is 72

hints.text: Use backticks for the string: `` `The temperature in ${city} is ${temperature}` ``

commonMistakes.consequence: `'The temperature in ${city}...'` prints the variable names literally.
commonMistakes.correction: Use backticks (key above Tab) for Template Literals.

commonMistakes.consequence: Cities don't usually change names, so `const` is better.
